author: Yong Pung How CJ:
casename: Mohd Aslam s/o Jahandad v Public Prosecutor
counsel: Mahendra Prasad Rai (Cooma & Rai) for the appellant; Glenn Seah (Deputy Public Prosecutor) for the respondent
tags: Criminal Procedure and Sentencing/Irregularities in proceedings
tags-parsed: Criminal Procedure and Sentencing/Irregularities in proceedings/Accused convicted based on uncorroborated evidence of sole witness/No finding by trial judge that sole witness's evidence so compelling that conviction could be secured by such evidence alone/Whether accused's conviction should be set aside
Evidence/Witnesses/Examination/Prosecution not challenging certain parts of Defence's evidence/Whether Prosecution thereby accepting such evidence
Evidence/Witnesses/Whether witness who neither pleads guilty to nor is convicted of offence may be regarded as accomplice to offence

Immigration/Criminal offences/Abetment of making of false statement to obtain employment pass and to renew employment pass/Requisite mens rea for offence/Whether accused having mens rea at material time/Section 57(1)(k) Immigration Act (Cap 133, 1997 Rev Ed), s 109 Penal Code (Cap 224, 1985 Rev Ed)
